item.title: The Official Xbox Wireless Headset Is Under $100
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Whenever Black Friday rolls around, you can usually expect big discounts on wireless headsets. So far, we're seeing tons of deals on gear from SteelSeries, Razer, and other manufacturers, but if you're looking to build a dedicated hardware ecosystem, then you'll want to check out this deal on the Xbox Wireless Gaming Headset. On sale for $96 (was $120), this headset offers solid audio and more at this price point.

Xbox Wireless Headset

$96 (was $120)

This updated version of the over-the-ear headset offers advanced surround sound, Dolby Atmos support, and up to 20 hours of battery life from a full charge. The microphone was also upgraded with enhanced auto-mute and voice-isolation features, and it supports Bluetooth 5.3. The official Xbox headset is a sleek device with a subtle black color scheme, and its lightweight headband is adjustable for multiple head sizes.

Other functions, such as voice and audio balance, can be tweaked on the fly with the rotating earcup dials, and the headset is compatible with PC, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and mobile devices.

While this Xbox headset is good, there are better options if you don't mind paying a little bit more. The SteelSeries Arctis Pro has long been one of GameSpot's favorite headsets, and the multi-platform version designed for PC, Xbox, PlayStation, and Switch is on sale for $290 (was $380). A combination of high-quality audio and premium materials, the Arctis Pro offers features such as active noise cancellation, 360-degree spatial audio, and the ability to mix two audio sources simultaneously. It comes with a base station featuring an OLED display, and you can hot-swap batteries while playing.

The SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5X is a budget-friendly option at $105 (was $150) that's compatible with Xbox, PS5, Switch, PC, and mobile devices. One of its selling points is a 60-hour battery life, and it also comes preloaded with hundreds of preset audio options for different games. This makes it very easy to optimize its performance across games like Call of Duty, GTA V, and more, while the on-ear controls make it simple to access various functions. We've also rounded up several more headsets below on sale for Black Friday, ranging from extremely cheap wired models from PowerA and Turtle Beach to premium discounted options like the Razer Blackshark V2 Pro and the Corsair HS80 Max. And don't forget to check GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for even more discounts.

More Xbox Headset Black Friday Deals

  • Corsair Void V2 Max -- $120 ($150)
  • Corsair HS80 Max -- $140 ($190)
  • PowerA Stereo headset (wired) -- $17 ($20)
  • Razer BlackShark V3 X -- $75 ($100)
  • Razer BlackShark V2 Pro -- $110 ($200)
  • RIG 800 Pro HX -- $100 ($165)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Pro -- $290 ($380)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5X -- $105 ($150)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro (wired) -- $150 ($250)
  • Turtle Beach Recon Spark (wired) -- $40 ($50)
  • Turtle Beach Recon 200 Gen 2 (wired) -- $30 ($60)
  • Turtle Beach Stealth 600 -- $89 ($110)
  • Xbox Wireless Gaming Headset -- $96 ($120)

item.title: The Best Deals In Woot's Black Friday Video Game Mega Sale
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon is a great spot to find Black Friday deals, but don't miss out on the discounts at Woot. Though it's not as popular, Woot is an Amazon company--meaning you can easily sign in with your Amazon account--and right now it's running the aptly named Video Game Mega Sale. Dozens of games and accessories are on sale until December 2, and we've listed some of our favorites below. However, Woot is offering a Black Friday-exclusive bonus offer for an additional 20% (up to a maximum $40 discount) when purchasing these items through the Woot app on your smartphone until Black Friday ends. You'll see the final discounted price at the very end of the checkout process (no promo code required), so consider downloading the app to save a few extra bucks. Check out our picks for the best Switch, Switch 2, PS5, and gaming accessory deals in Woot's sake below. And don't forget to hit up GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for more of the best discounts available this weekend.

Switch 1 & 2 Game Deals

Only a few Switch 2 games are discounted at Woot, including Mario Kart World, The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition, and Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV. The standard deals for all three aren't exciting (they're just $1 off), but you can save 20% when you purchase through the Woot app. That would bring Breath of the Wild down to $55.20 and both Mario Kart World and Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV to $63.20 each.

Switch games are seeing much better deals. The ever-popular Animal Crossing: New Horizons is just $47 (was $60), and the cozy adventure is a perfect match for the cold winter days ahead. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and Super Smash Bros. Ultimate are both discounted to $45 each (normally $60), while Luigi's Mansion 3 is down to $30 (was $60), and Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze is $47 (was $60). Check out even more Switch game deals below

Switch 2 Games

  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $69 ($70)
  • Mario Kart World -- $79 ($80)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $79 ($80)

Switch Games

  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons -- $47 ($60)
  • Bayonetta Origins: Cereza and the Lost Demon -- $39 ($60)
  • Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze -- $47 ($60)
  • Luigi's Mansion 3 -- $30 ($60)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom -- $47 ($70)
  • Mario Golf: Super Rush -- $45 ($60)
  • Mario Kart 8 Deluxe -- $45 ($60)
  • Mario Party Superstars -- $47 ($60)
  • New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe -- $47 ($60)
  • Nintendo Switch Sports -- $30 ($50)
  • Pokemon Legends: Arceus -- $47 ($60)
  • Pokemon Let's Go, Pikachu -- $47 ($60)
  • Pokemon Scarlet -- $47 ($60)
  • Pokemon Violet -- $47 ($60)
  • Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury -- $45 ($60)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree -- $47 ($60)
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder -- $47 ($60)
  • Super Smash Bros. Ultimate -- $45 ($60)
  • Yu-Gi-Oh: Early Days Collection -- $20 ($50)

PlayStation 5 Game Deals

There aren't as many PS5 games on sale as there are Switch, but there are still a few worth checking out. Dynasty Warriors: Origins dropped earlier this year, offering a fresh take on the musou genre. The action plays out on a much larger scale, though there's still plenty of nuance to the chaos--along with slashing through hundreds of foes, you can also employ parries and counters to take down more difficult enemies.

Other highlights include Elden Ring: Nightreign for $33 (was $55), NickToons & The Dice of Destiny: Collector's Edition for $35 (was $80), and Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Edition for $150 (was $200). The latter comes with heaps of collectible goodies, including a cool terrarium diorama. Speaking of cool collector's editions, the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4: Collector's Edition is also seeing a generous discount to just $80 (was $129). Along with the game, you'll get a full-size, limited edition Birdhouse Wings Skateboard Deck to display in your home, plus a selection of in-game cosmetics.

We've listed a few more of our favorite PS5 deals below.

  • Darksiders 2: Deathinitive Edition -- $20 ($30)
  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins -- $35 ($70)
  • Elden Ring: Nightreign (Amazon Edition) -- $33 ($55)
  • Lego Horizon Adventures -- $19 ($60)
  • Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Collector's Edition -- $150 ($200)
  • NickToons & The Dice of Destiny: Collector's Edition -- $35 ($80)
  • RoboCop Rogue City -- $20 ($60)
  • Sid Meier's Civilization VII -- $30 ($70)
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations -- $24 ($50)
  • Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4: Collector's Edition -- $80 ($129)

Accessories & Hardware Deals

Woot's sale also includes video game hardware and accessories. If you picked up a Switch 2 console this year, a good travel case is a must. A bunch are on sale right now, including the Game Traveler Deluxe Crossbody Bag in both Vertical and Horizontal styles. Both are listed for $20 (was $30),. The protective bags feature a durable exterior and cushioned interior to keep your handheld safe while on the go. And if you want to enjoy Switch 2 multiplayer, the Hori USB Camera is $25 (was $35) and is fully compatible with GameChat.

PC peripherals like Razer's BlackWidow V4 75% Wired Keyboard and BlackWidow V4 Low Profile TKL Wireless Keyboard are also on sale. Both keyboard models are discounted to well below their $200 list prices--the BlackWidow V4 75% Wired Keyboard now just $150, while the BlackWidow V4 Low Profile TKL Wireless Keyboard is $160. They're equipped with media keys and a roller for easy access to your most-used controls, customizable RGB lights, and are built to the usual high standards of Razer. Note that the 75% model includes a wrist rest and is wired, while the TKL model is wireless and can last up to 980 hours on a single charge when placed in Power Saving Mode. Be sure to check out the links below for more of our favorite gaming and accessories and PC peripherals on sale at Woot.

  • CRKD Neo S Wireless Controller: Peely Edition (Switch, PC, Mobile) -- $25 ($60)
  • Game Traveler Deluxe Crossbody Vertical Bag (Switch 2) -- $20 ($30)
  • Game Traveler Deluxe Crossbody Horizontal Bag (Switch 2) -- $20 ($29)
  • Hori USB Camera (Switch 2) -- $25 ($35)
  • Hori Wireless Fighting Commander Octa Pro Fightpad (PS5, PC) -- $75 ($110)
  • Numskull Fortnite Llama Hard Shell Travel Case (Switch) -- $10 ($20)
  • PowerA Crossbody Bag: Metroid (Switch) -- $15 ($20)
  • PowerA Wired Earbuds (Metroid) -- $10 ($25)
  • PowerA Wireless Controller (Switch) -- $25 ($45)
  • Razer BlackShark V3 X Wireless Headset (PS5, Switch, PC, Mobile) -- $70 ($100)
  • Razer BlackWidow V4 75% Wired Keyboard -- $150 ($200)
  • Razer BlackWidow V4 Low Profile TKL Wireless Keyboard -- $160 ($200)
  • Razer Wolverine V3 Tournament Edition Wired Controller (Xbox, PC) -- $55 ($100)
